titleStmt.title: C. H. Lee, et al., to Unknown
CWG9455

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency the Govnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, the undersigned Citizens of Bracken County would respectfully represent unto your excellency that at the last ^Term^ term ^1861^ of the Bracken Circuit Court in the case of the Commonwealth against Llewlyn Galaspie the jury empanneled in in said case fined the said Galspie one hundred and four dollars from the evidence and under the instructions of the court for the obstructions of a public road in said County by removing his fence and placing a portion of it in the track of the old road and at One point cross the same and let it remain there for the space of one hundred and four days and at the same time cut a road out side of Said fence and placed said road on as good ground with the exception of one place as the Old road. and thereby made it a shorter rout, said road ran over the land of Galaspie and mostly through the woods and in a sparcely settled neighbourhood and that the road is not generally used by persons except on horseback and on foot, notwithstanding said Galspie obstructed the road as aforesaid we believe the public was not injured by said obstruction, and the said Galspie being a
poor man with a wife and a number of Children to support, we the undersigned citizens would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said fine or so much thereof as the law will permit.

Yours respectfully
C. H. Lee
G W Holton
Wm Fallin
James Brown
Augustus Wood
Robt Cabell
Cornelius Mcavoy
Edward Flood
